description: These are certifications that I think would be useful to get for various reasons. They would help to build your resume and teach you about important and useful skills in "real-world" software engineering. While I've never attained any of these certifications myself, I still think they could be very useful and teach you good information.

Cloud Certifications.Name: Amazon Web Services
Cloud Certifications.Cost: $100 to take the test, free retake/preparation

Cloud Certifications.Name: IBM Cloud
Cloud Certifications.Cost: Free to take the course. No final exam.

Certifications for Essential Skills.Name: Kubernetes and Docker
Certifications for Essential Skills.Description: This is a course, not a certification. However, you can still definitely put your completion of it on your resume.
Certifications for Essential Skills.Certification: Docker and Kubernetes: The Complete Guide

Certifications for Essential Skills.Name: GitHub and Git
Certifications for Essential Skills.Description: The only class at UNCW where we used GitHub was CSC 450. I think it would be very useful to learn about it beforehand as it's a MANDATORY skill to have as a software engineer. A certification will help show you actually know what you're doing and teach you important skills as well. I think using Git and GitHub for a personal project would also be a great way to learn it.

Certifications for Essential Skills.Name: JUnit and Mockito
Certifications for Essential Skills.Description: UNCW doesn't really teach software testing. While you may not need to know these two specific frameworks for your job, they are commonly used and will help you learn the basics. Testing is also commonly asked about in interviews. Also note that this is a course, not a certification. However, you can still definitely put your completion of it on your resume.

Academic Certifications and Degrees.Name: UNC Web Developer Boot Camp
Academic Certifications and Degrees.Cost: They don't say. They just say "Financial options are available. Contact us to discuss your options."

Academic Certifications and Degrees.Name: Online Georgia Tech Masters Degree
Academic Certifications and Degrees.Description: I saw a guy who went to UNCW on LinkedIn get this degree. He said he had a 2.8 gpa so I don't think it's too difficult to get into.
Academic Certifications and Degrees.Cost: $5400 total ($180 per credit hour. 30 credit hours)

Academic Certifications and Degrees.Name: Stanford AI Program
Academic Certifications and Degrees.Cost: $1,750 per course. 8 courses to choose from.

GeneralTips.Name: Get Certifications From A Company you Want to Work At
GeneralTips.Description: If you want to work at Cisco, IBM, etc. get certifications from those companies to show commitment.

GeneralTips.Name: These Courses Might be Free at Your Job
GeneralTips.Description: I'm aware some of these certifications are pricey, but some of them might be free at your job. Like IBM offers a ton of free training courses, and USAA offered free Udemy courses.

GeneralTips.Name: Focus on One Certification at a Time
GeneralTips.Description: If you decide to get more than one of these certifications, try to focus on one at a time and actually follow through with it.

GeneralTips.Name: A Job might be worth as much as a Masters Degree
GeneralTips.Description: As you can tell some of these degrees and certifications are pricey. I feel like getting a job at a company can be worth just as much as a masters degree and you'll be getting paid instead of loosing money. I also think real-world experience with these skills can be just as valuable, if not more valuable than these certifications.

GeneralTips.Name: Get an AWS Certification
GeneralTips.Description: If you do get any of these certifications, I recommend the AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner one. While I don't have it myself, it's reasonably priced, seems to teach good information, and is a sought after skill in the job market.
